text: The Cadillac BLS is a Compact car made by the American car company Cadillac. It was sold mostly in Europe and was made from 2005 to 2009. The BLS was a special version of the Saab 9-3, made by Saab in Sweden. It was built on the same platform as other cars like the Chevrolet Malibu and Opel Vectra. The BLS was Cadillac's first compact car in Europe and was never sold in North America. == Design and Features == The Cadillac BLS was designed to compete with other small luxury cars in Europe. The car came with petrol and diesel engines it was sold with both manual and automatic transmissions The BLS was available with many safety and comfort features like airbags, air conditioning, and leather seats. == Sales and Market == The Cadillac BLS was sold mainly in Europe, but it was also available in the Middle East, Mexico, South Africa, and South Korea It was not sold in the United States or Canada. == Discontinuation == The BLS ended production in 2009 and was replaced by the Cadillac ATS. == References == Category:Sedans BLS Category:2000s automobiles Category:2010s automobiles
title: Cadillac BLS
